body: IIRC this was tested both by the reporter and by @lucab on Debian's AArch64 build: https://github.com/joyent/libuv/issues/1443 any chance things should be handled differently depending on the architecture here?
Ah, wait, in libuv we always pass NULL to the call `uv__epoll_pwait`, that's why it never surfaced. LGTM if you are sure it works. But otherwise we can fix it later too :-)
musl libc also does it, so land it at will.
Cheers, landed in v0.10 in b705b53.  What's the current strategy for up-merges?  At will or after a release?
Usually after a release, but if you need it feel free to up-merge.
No rush, I'll wait for the next release.

issue.title: Crash in uv__async_event
issue.body:
**Environment**
=> node 4.x or later, but looking at the libuv changes in the async area, I think it should be applicable to any version greater than 0.12
=> libuv 1.8.0
=> Linux x64, but I am able to reproduce in PPC linux as well. I haven't tried in other platforms, but looking at the problem symptom, looks like this will fail in all 64 bit platforms with weakly consistent memory models (such as amd, ppc)

**Recreate**
https://github.com/gireeshpunathil/libuvcrashasync

foo.cc has the main addon code. Please ignore some unrealistic stuff in the code (such as randomizer thread, tight loop in the worker threads etc.), they are added only to bring about the problem faster. In the real case, the crash happens after hours.

**Callstack**

`
(gdb) where
#0  0x00000000019c3ee0 in default_loop_struct ()
#1  0x0000000000faf4db in uv__async_event (loop=0x19c3d40, w=Unhandled dwarf expression opcode 0xf3

) at ../deps/uv/src/unix/async.c:98
#2  0x0000000000faf5b3 in uv__async_io (loop=0x19c3d40, w=0x19c3f08, events=Unhandled dwarf expression opcode 0xf3

) at ../deps/uv/src/unix/async.c:138
#3  0x0000000000fbf655 in uv__io_poll (loop=0x19c3d40, timeout=-1) at ../deps/uv/src/unix/linux-core.c:345
#4  0x0000000000fb0096 in uv_run (loop=0x19c3d40, mode=UV_RUN_ONCE) at ../deps/uv/src/unix/core.c:351
#5  0x0000000000dfcd08 in node::Start(int, char**) ()
#6  0x00000034d041ed5d in __libc_start_main () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#7  0x000000000072233d in _start ()

`

**My observations**
a. While the API documentation on async messages [about](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/async.html) thread safety of these interactions, I don't see sufficient provision for multi-thread data access primitives (such as mutexes, memory barriers etc. ) in libuv data structures to support this.

b. The code may be seen as re-registering new async events for the same listener, and the crash is avoided if we do registration once and async_send as many times. But in real scenario, this re-registration may be new registrations with different listeners, and when the number of threads as well as their frequency of new async registration increases, the multi-thread loop data access increases, and increases the chance of corruption.

Thanks in advance.

issue.title: dns/bind 9.16.2 crashes with libuv v1.36.0
issue.body:
Yesterday I upgraded the FreeBSD port of libuv to 1.36.0.
Since then, several users reported crashes of Bind: see https://bugs.freebsd.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=245653
An experimental patch has been proposed by  Tatsuki Makino: see https://bz-attachments.freebsd.org/attachment.cgi?id=213441&action=diff&format=raw&headers=1
